column5: Hi all, Finally got out with a fellow board member from my neck of the woods. John certainly knows his stuff and freely shares his expertise. He took me to one of his crappie hotspots and it did not disappoint....great morning out, we plan to fish a lot together in the future, here is a video of some of the action. THANKS JOHN!VIDEOhttps://youtu.be/rvIHUgZWW60
Thanks for coming.great time.hope we get to go again soon.after the thunder storms leave us.

Looks like fun! Warm temperatures and rain today mean our lakes are now covered with water. A guy could drown without falling through the ice! I got some crappies last week but it might be a while before I get back onto the ice/water. Thanks for the reminder of what winter is supposed to look like.

We had some heavy rain all day yesterday so iam sure it lakes wont have any snow left.already was getting bare on sunday when i went for trout.tough conditions on a sled.thinking it will be the atv next trip.
Looks like a great day .. Wish I was there .. Next time ..

We crappie fished from snow machines yesterday (Tuesday). The lake was covered with water, good lubrication for the sliders, but snowmobiles were not the right tool for the job, we are taking the side by side trout fishing today instead. Looking forward to the colder temperatures that are coming our way, then a good snow!
Took the bike this morning.much better.couple of soft spots.solo trip for two hrs.trout definatly aggressive today.
